summary: Thiamine, also called vitamin B1, is a vital nutrient for people and animals. It helps break down food for energy. You can get it from whole grains, legumes, meat, and fish, but processing grains often removes it, so many countries add it back to cereal and flour. Thiamine supplements can prevent deficiencies and treat conditions like beriberi. They're usually safe, but some people might have allergic reactions to injected doses. Thiamine is an important medicine recognized by the World Health Organization.
title: Thiamine
